verses.verse: Thinkest<WH2803> thou this to be right<WH4941>, that thou saidst<WH559>, My righteousness<WH6664> is more than God's<WH410>?
For thou saidst<WH559>, What advantage<WH5532> will it be unto thee? and, What profit<WH3276> shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin<WH2403>?
I will answer<WH7725><WH4405> thee, and thy companions<WH7453> with thee.
Look<WH5027> unto the heavens<WH8064>, and see<WH7200>; and behold<WH7789> the clouds<WH7834> which are higher<WH1361> than thou.
If thou sinnest<WH2398>, what doest<WH6466> thou against him? or if thy transgressions<WH6588> be multiplied<WH7231>, what doest<WH6213> thou unto him?
If thou be righteous<WH6663>, what givest<WH5414> thou him? or what receiveth<WH3947> he of thine hand<WH3027>?
Thy wickedness<WH7562> may hurt a man<WH376> as thou art; and thy righteousness<WH6666> may profit the son<WH1121> of man<WH120>.
By reason of the multitude<WH7230> of oppressions<WH6217> they make the oppressed to cry<WH2199>: they cry out<WH7768> by reason of the arm<WH2220> of the mighty<WH7227>.
But none saith<WH559>, Where is God<WH433> my maker<WH6213>, who giveth<WH5414> songs<WH2158> in the night<WH3915>;
Who teacheth<WH502> us more than the beasts<WH929> of the earth<WH776>, and maketh us wiser<WH2449> than the fowls<WH5775> of heaven<WH8064>?
There they cry<WH6817>, but none giveth answer<WH6030>, because<WH6440> of the pride<WH1347> of evil men<WH7451>.
Surely God<WH410> will not hear<WH8085> vanity<WH7723>, neither will the Almighty<WH7706> regard<WH7789> it.
Although<WH637> thou sayest<WH559> thou shalt not see<WH7789> him, yet judgment<WH1779> is before<WH6440> him; therefore trust<WH2342> thou in him.
But now, because it is not so, he hath visited<WH6485> in his anger<WH639>; yet he knoweth<WH3045> it not in great<WH3966> extremity<WH6580>:
Therefore doth Job<WH347> open<WH6475> his mouth<WH6310> in vain<WH1892>; he multiplieth<WH3527> words<WH4405> without<WH1097> knowledge<WH1847>.
